Query Transactions
resources.description: Route provides filtering methods to query transactions by type (cashIn or cashOut) and/or createdAt Date

resources.name: Transactions
resources.description: This set of routes responsible for handling the transfer (transaction) between users, and list of transactions

resources.name: Ng Cash
resources.description:
NG-Test Application

**Created By: Jenifer G. da Silva**

[Jenifer Goncalves | LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jenifergoncalvesdev/)

[jenifergs (Jenifer Gon√ßalves) ¬∑ GitHub](https://github.com/jenifergs)

resources.name: Get All Transactions
resources.description: Returns the list of transactions that the logged in user participated in

resources.name: Transfer
resources.description:
Transfers an amount from the account user account 'cashOut' to the account user 'cashIn'

**The following rules are checked for carrying out the transaction**

- The transaction only happens if the user of the cashOut account is logged in
- The transaction only takes place if the cashOut account user has a balance greater than or equal to the transfer amount.

resources.name: Get User Ballance
resources.description: Return data from the account balance on the logged user

resources.name: Ballance
resources.description: Return data from the account balance on the logged user

resources.name: Authentication
resources.description:
Generates an access token from a user's credentials, valid for next 24 hours

**For optimization, authentication will only be performed if:**

- Username must be have at least 3 characters
- Password must be have at least 8 characters beign a number and a capital letter

resources.name: Users
resources.description: User routes allow user creation and login

resources.name: Create User
resources.description:
This Route create a new user from a username that must be unique and a valid password and returns an access token valid for the next 24 hours.

**The following rules are used for user creation:**

- Must be unique username
- Username must be have at least 3 characters
- Password must be have at least 8 characters beign a number and a capital letter

resources.name: Healthcheck
resources.description: Verify if the server is on

resources.name: Healthcheck
resources.description: This route exists to check if the server is active

resources.contents:
openapi: 3.0.0 paths: /users: post: operationId: UserController_create parameters: [] requestBody: required: true content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/CreateUserDto' responses: '201': description: '' content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/CreatedUserDto' '400': description: |- On status 400 are the following exceptions: - EXCEPTION: CannotCreateUserException - EXCEPTION: Validation error > *See Schema to see the details of the exceptions.* content: application/json: schema: anyOf: - title: CannotCreateUserException description: >- This exception is thrown when the user cannot be created because of some error in the database example: >- {"httpStatusCode":400,"codeError":"MAAS-USER-001","message":"Can not create user","name":"CannotCreateUserException","parameters":{"email":"any@gmail.com"}} - title: Validation error description: >- This error occurs when the validation of data sent by client into DTO fails. It is a common error when the client sends data that is not valid. fields: { - statusCode: number - message: string - error: string } statusCode indicates the status code of the error. message its an array of strings with the errors that occurred. error is the name of the error that occurred. example: >- {"statusCode":400,"message":["email must be an email"],"error":"Bad Request"} security: - JWT: [] /auth/sign-in: post: operationId: AuthenticationController_signIn parameters: [] requestBody: required: true content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/SignInDto' responses: '201': description: '' content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/SignedUserDto' '400': description: |- On status 400 are the following exceptions: - EXCEPTION: NotMatchingPasswordsException - EXCEPTION: UserNotFoundException - EXCEPTION: Validation error > *See Schema to see the details of the exceptions.* content: application/json: schema: anyOf: - title: NotMatchingPasswordsException description: >- This exception is thrown when the password does not match the user password example: >- {"httpStatusCode":400,"codeError":"MAAS-AUTH-001","message":"Passwords do not match","name":"NotMatchingPasswordsException"} - title: UserNotFoundException description: This exception is thrown when the user is not found example: >- {"httpStatusCode":400,"codeError":"MAAS-AUTH-002","message":"User not found","name":"UserNotFoundException","parameters":{"email":"any@gmail.com"}} - title: Validation error description: >- This error occurs when the validation of data sent by client into DTO fails. It is a common error when the client sends data that is not valid. fields: { - statusCode: number - message: string - error: string } statusCode indicates the status code of the error. message its an array of strings with the errors that occurred. error is the name of the error that occurred. example: >- {"statusCode":400,"message":["email must be an email"],"error":"Bad Request"} /auth/refresh-token: post: operationId: AuthenticationController_refreshToken parameters: [] requestBody: required: true content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/RefreshTokenDto' responses: '201': description: '' content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/SignedUserDto' '400': description: |- On status 400 are the following exceptions: - EXCEPTION: NotMatchingRefreshTokenException - EXCEPTION: UserNotFoundException - EXCEPTION: Validation error > *See Schema to see the details of the exceptions.* content: application/json: schema: anyOf: - title: NotMatchingRefreshTokenException description: >- This exception is thrown when the refresh token does not match the user refresh token example: >- {"httpStatusCode":400,"codeError":"MAAS-AUTH-003","message":"Refresh Token do not match","name":"NotMatchingRefreshTokenException"} - title: UserNotFoundException description: This exception is thrown when the user is not found example: >- {"httpStatusCode":400,"codeError":"MAAS-AUTH-002","message":"User not found","name":"UserNotFoundException","parameters":{"email":"any@gmail.com"}} - title: Validation error description: >- This error occurs when the validation of data sent by client into DTO fails. It is a common error when the client sends data that is not valid. fields: { - statusCode: number - message: string - error: string } statusCode indicates the status code of the error. message its an array of strings with the errors that occurred. error is the name of the error that occurred. example: >- {"statusCode":400,"message":["email must be an email"],"error":"Bad Request"} /banners: post: operationId: BannerController_create summary: Create a new banner in the system description: >- Important Thing: The image must be passed as a buffer. Javascript Example :
var formdata = new FormData(); formdata.append("title", "praesentium"); formdata.append("categoryId", "dab59d1e-142a-11ed-a447-0242ac120002"); formdata.append("marketplaceId", "cf7379fc-1297-11ed-8b75-0242ac120002"); formdata.append("buttonText", "Vel ad quo earum iure."); formdata.append("url", "http://impartial-stalk.com"); formdata.append("imageData", fileInput.files[0], "/Users/bedfordshire.scd.teicorpus.png"); var requestOptions = { method: 'POST', body: formdata, redirect: 'follow' }; fetch("http://localhost:3000/banners", requestOptions) .then(response => response.text()) .then(result => console.log(result)) .catch(error => console.log('error', error)); parameters: - name: Content-Type in: header description: >- Content-Type header must be multipart/form-data; boundary=calculated when request is sent required: true schema: type: string requestBody: required: true content: multipart/form-data: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/RequestCreateOrUpdateBannerDto' responses: '201': description: '' content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/CreatedEntityDto' '400': description: |- On status 400 are the following exceptions: - EXCEPTION: MaximiumBannersReachingException - EXCEPTION: MarketplaceDoesNotExistsException - EXCEPTION: BannerCategoryDoesNotExist - EXCEPTION: CreateBannerException - EXCEPTION: UploadImageException - EXCEPTION: Validation error > *See Schema to see the details of the exceptions.* content: application/json: schema: anyOf: - title: MaximiumBannersReachingException description: >- This exception is thrown when maximum banners are reaching for this category example: >- {"codeError":"MAXIMUM_BANNERS_REACHING_EXCEPTION","httpStatusCode":400,"message":"Maximum banners reaching, you can not add more banners for this category","name":"MaximiumBannersReachingException","parameters":{"called":{"title":"Hamburguer Banner"}}} - title: MarketplaceDoesNotExistsException description: >- This error is thrown when the marketplace does not registered in the system example: >- {"codeError":"MAAS-PUBLICITY-002","httpStatusCode":502,"originalError":{},"message":"Marketplace does not exists","name":"MarketplaceDoesNotExistsException","parameters":{"marketplaceId":"023666c8-5c08-4681-9d2b-3936e4d818c6"}} - title: BannerCategoryDoesNotExist description: >- This exception is thrown when the banner category does not exist in the system example: >- {"codeError":"MAAS-PUBLICITY-001","httpStatusCode":400,"message":"Banner category does not exist","name":"BannerCategoryDoesNotExist","originalError":{},"parameters":{"categoryId":"fb92f4d4-43ea-4043-9fdf-a9a7f91545b3"}} - title: CreateBannerException description: >- This exception is thrown with an untreated exception it throwed in creation example: >- {"codeError":"CREATE_BANNER_EXCEPTION","httpStatusCode":502,"message":"Banner is not created","name":"CreateBannerException","originalError":{},"parameters":{"title":"Title","url":"https://www.google.com","category":{"id":"9f30092f-f865-43fb-8826-02a5eba85cd9"},"marketplace":{"id":"023666c8-5c08-4681-9d2b-3936e4d818c6"}}} - title: UploadImageException description: >- This exception is thrown when any error occurs during image upload example: >- {"codeError":"MAAS-PUBLICITY-003","httpStatusCode":502,"message":"Image is not uploaded","name":"UploadImageException","originalError":{}} - title: Validation error description: >- This error occurs when the validation of data sent by client into DTO fails. It is a common error when the client sends data that is not valid. fields: { - statusCode: number - message: string - error: string } statusCode indicates the status code of the error. message its an array of strings with the errors that occurred. error is the name of the error that occurred. example: >- {"statusCode":400,"message":["email must be an email"],"error":"Bad Request"} '401': &ref_0 description: >- Unauthorized response is returned if token is not provided in header or is invalid '403': &ref_1 description: >- Forbidden response is returned if user is not authorized to access an route tags: &ref_2 - Banners security: &ref_3 - JWT: [] /banners/{id}: put: operationId: BannerController_update summary: Update Banners description: >- Put is different from patch, as put forces complete replacement of data, this includes a new ID
Important Thing: The image must be passed as a buffer. Javascript Example :
var myHeaders = new Headers(); myHeaders.append("accept", "application/json"); myHeaders.append("Content-Type", "application/json"); var formdata = new FormData(); formdata.append("title", "Omnis2"); formdata.append("imageData", fileInput.files[0], "/C:/Users/rafael.pereira_south/Documents/authdb.png"); formdata.append("id", "1ea26958-18b0-11ed-b494-0242bc120002"); formdata.append("categoryId", "dab59d1e-142a-11ed-a447-0242ac120002"); formdata.append("marketplaceId", "cf7379fc-1297-11ed-8b75-0242ac120002"); formdata.append("buttonText", "Abcdef AJNDJSADA"); formdata.append("url", "http://abcdef"); var requestOptions = { method: 'PUT', headers: myHeaders, body: formdata, redirect: 'follow' }; fetch("http://localhost:3000/banners/1ea26958-18b0-11ed-b494-0242ac120002", requestOptions) .then(response => response.text()) .then(result => console.log(result)) .catch(error => console.log('error', error)); name: MaaS description: '' servers: [] components: securitySchemes: JWT: scheme: bearer bearerFormat: JWT type: http name: JWT description: Enter JWT token in: header schemas: CreateUserDto: type: object properties: email: type: string firstName: type: string minLength: 2 maxLength: 255 lastName: type: string minLength: 2 maxLength: 255 marketplace: type: object description: |- { id: "7267c7fb-01ea-45a9-9c2c-8781b5f12f2b" } or { name: "Itau" } group: type: object description: |- { id: "7267c7fb-01ea-45a9-9c2c-8781b5f12f2b" } or { name: "Superuser" } required: - email - firstName - lastName - marketplace - group CreatedUserDto: type: object properties: id: type: string generatedPassword: type: string required: - id - generatedPassword SignInDto: type: object properties: email: type: string description: |- Email of user example any@email.com password: type: string description: >- Password of user example Any string with AlphaNumeric characters and Simbolic characters with length > 6 keepSignedIn: type: boolean required: - email - password - keepSignedIn SignedUserDto: type: object properties: token: type: string refreshToken: type: string expiresAt: format: date-time type: string refreshTokenExpiresAt: format: date-time type: string required: - token - refreshToken - expiresAt - refreshTokenExpiresAt RefreshTokenDto: type: object properties: token: type: string email: type: string required: - token - email RequestCreateOrUpdateBannerDto: type: object properties: imageData: type: object description: Banner Data. Its a image nullable: false title: type: string description: 'Description: Banner title' categoryId: type: string description: 'Description: categoryId is a string with the id of the category' marketplaceId: type: string description: >- Description: marketplaceId is a string with the id of the marketplace buttonText: type: string description: 'Description: buttonText is a string with the text of the button' url: type: string description: 'Description: image is a string with the image' required: - imageData - title - categoryId - marketplaceId - buttonText - url CreatedEntityDto: type: object properties: id: type: string description: >- Description: Entity id it's an unique identifier for each entity (uuid) entity: type: string description: 'Description: Table name of the entity' createdAt: format: date-time type: string description: 'Description: Created At is a date with the register of creation' createdFields: type: object description: >- Description: Description of created values this mean the values that are created in the database required: - id - entity FullUpdateBannerDto: type: object properties: imageData: type: object description: Banner Data. resources.code:
const response1 = await insomnia.send();
expect(response1.status).to.equal(200);
const body = JSON.parse(response1.data)
console.log(body)
expect(body).to.have.property('id')
expect(body).to.have.property('buttonText')
expect(body).to.have.property('category')
expect(body).to.have.property('image')
expect(body).to.have.property('marketplace')
expect(body).to.have.property('title')
expect(body).to.have.property('url')
